column4: Imark, the Skype client will only allow me to select Pulseaudio in the microphone options
Is there a special channel for just sound or microphones for Ubuntu?
no, but alsaproject is on the inet, also work through :
mic is often muted per default, read given troubleshooting links, first make sure alsamixergui displays your chip correctly (hint for correct driver inkernel)
already did that.  Mic is on
I've been through the basic troubleshooting what google and ubuntu forums post
mind your s-card is other hardware than your cam's mic
thats what I was thinking...I have two competing IRQs perhaps
how to I get ubuntu to use the Logitech exclusively?
you should, corresponding rather; not at all but to check for unmuting, will have to switch that s-card first (klang/sound)
I have in the audio switches an internal and an external mic and capture option.  Is this what you are refering to?
yes
another try to just get the functional test might be audacious
and chip displayed ? no hints in syslog  ( like unknown device..)
you mean lsusb?
no, I wonder if correct kerneldriver/modul for that mic is loaded
rather a goodie, checkaout :
good idea.  Let me see if the microphone component of this webcam is flagged
sometimes recompiling alsa does the trick, if cam wasn't plugged at install and modules are missing, lookup  yourself both alsa and hcl
I could reinstall Xubuntu with cam plugged in as a last resort
very last, common hw http://www.alsa-project.org/main/index.php/Main_Page
